thread.title: Ethiopia: Country, U.S Enjoy Not Superficial but Solid Ties
thread.title_full: Ethiopia: Country, U.S Enjoy Not Superficial but Solid Ties

title: Ethiopia: Country, U.S Enjoy Not Superficial but Solid Ties
text:
Rwanda: 'Too Early to Replace Kagame' 
Many countries are keen to work closely with the country. Obama's plan to visit the country proves a manifestation of this fact. "Obama's visit to Ethiopia would be a first high level visit since Richard Niksson's visit as a vice President in 1957," he noted. 
The president's planed sojourn here is meaningful to Ethiopia. It is counted as a vote of confidence tantamount to extending hails for the fast economic growth Ethiopia is making in the past two decades. Presidents and leaders of various countries have visited Ethiopia hence Obama's planned visit will give an opportunity for the country to showcase its potentials. 
The president's visit will help Ethiopia to leverage its socioeconomic potential to the international community. The visit sheds light on Ethiopia's success to remain peaceful and secured in the highly volatile eastern Africa region. 
Previously, the bilateral ties of the two countries were confined to humanitarian aids, however with Ethiopia's path-breaking move of unleashing potential towards a remarkable growth, the ties have blossomed to economic and political ones. 
The two countries' ties are glued in terms of economy, political relation, peace and security. Particularly, Ethiopia and the US have a commonality of interest, proneness and solid relation in the fight against terrorism. Ethiopia has been a major target of terrorists, the same is true with US. The need to militate against a common enemy prompt the two countries to work hand and glove to stave off the evil act. 
US have been supporting Ethiopian's fight to eradicate HIV-AIDS and other diseases. So also numerous US investors are keen to invest in Ethiopia. 
Observably bilateral or multilateral ties among countries turns out to be superficial but the relation of Ethiopia and US is a concrete one. 
Concerning, democracy and human right protection, the Director General sa+id observably, Ethiopia and the US do not have basic differences in the protection of human rights and the promotion of democracy. But the level of emphasis varies according to the countries' economic development. In fact, democracy is a matter of survival for Ethiopians and as such the incumbent has a firm stance on the matter. However democracy is not something that could take shape overnight. 
Some claims of human right violations at different levels could crop up. However, slowly but surely these problems would be addressed. Again, the differences is the level of emphasis the two countries accord to democracy, otherwise the two countries do not have a diametrically opposite difference, as Ethiopia attaches due attention to the pillars of democracy. 
Asked about the public's discomfort that the issue of homosexuality will be raised during the president's planned visit, the Director General responded that as the issue has never been a concern to our people it will not be tabled for discussion. Ethiopia
